background_dashed.customLabel: In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a small-to-moderate effect in favor of EIBI on Overall ASD symptoms. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 2 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a small-to-moderate effect in favor of EIBI on Social-communication. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 5 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a moderate-to-strong effect in favor of EIBI on Adaptive behaviors. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 10 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a moderate-to-strong effect in favor of EIBI on Global cognition (IQ). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 7 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a moderate-to-strong effect in favor of EIBI on Language (Expressive skills). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 4 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a very strong effect in favor of  EIBI on Language (Overall skills). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 3 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a moderate-to-strong effect in favor of EIBI on Language (Receptive skills). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 4 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a moderate-to-strong effect in favor of EIBI on Specific cognition (nvIQ). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 5 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a moderate-to-strong effect in favor of EIBI on Disruptive behaviors. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 2 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.
